title: 一人一信比蔡英文或外國傳媒

replies.msg:
開得呢種post預咗人屌，但如果你係想入黎屌我不如用多幾秒諗下有咩可以做。

留低既不妨集思廣益可以點做到國際關注。

1. 陸委會已經發聲明不會用引渡法引渡陳同佳

早在5月，陸委會指出香港政府不惜捨易取難，堅持以逃犯(修訂)條例將陳同佳引到台灣受審，其他可行的代替法案並不獲港府接受，但聲明似乎未能引起國際關注，經過69遊行，國際關注到民意所向，如果蔡英文總統能在期限前出到正式聲明表達其立場的話，可以藉此引起國際關注及報導，起到少許作用。

2. 外國傳媒只知道香港政府要推逃犯(修訂)條例，但未必知道背後原因

103萬人既遊行成功引起社會關注，但多數外國傳媒只係報導香港參與遊行人數及為逃犯條例而遊行，並未有提及政府強推修例既背後原因，香港政府如今只係藉以引渡陳同佳回台灣受審為由而強推修例，如果蔡英文總統能夠發出正式聲明表達其立場，香港政府變相再沒有理由此刻強推條例，希望能夠做到拖得一日得一日。

電郵內容大概如下：
1）香港政府推行條例原因及台灣陸委會的回應
2）限期為本月12日，期限近並要快速作出回應

如果有巴打文筆好的話，請幫幫手draft份example比埋大家用。今次香港比2014情況更危險，我地屋企存亡之際，請大家務必做盡所有野去拯救自己既屋企同所愛既野，做得一樣得一樣，做咗未必有用，冇做就一定冇用。

簡易傳送門：

中華民國總統府： https://service.president.gov.tw/newmailbox/write.aspx

CNN: http://www.cnn.com/feedback

New york times: https://help.nytimes.com/hc/en-us/articles/115014925288-How-to-submit-a-letter-to-the-editor

BBC news: https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/articles/Ypg5XtqMdkH0lvmL7GtqX6/contact-us

Fox news: https://help.foxnews.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

如果大家仲有其他傳送門就貼係下面方便大家！
希望大家用平時留言+1小編話你知既精神，send一封電郵出去！大家加油！
與其質疑成效，不如做咗先算，自己輕輕一推
大家記住推完要send email，send得一間得一間

大家有咩想發表可以討論下，大前提係email一定要以上既point，再有咩想加可以自己再加入去！！
繼續推佢老母
你外人聯署無用，要人哋自己國民先有用

行動派需要建立發言組織！
https://lihkg.com/thread/1198159/page/1
Send埋信去頭先 d link到，香港今次一定唔可以輸

replies.msg: 呢個時勢一定要魚翁撒網，唔再係討論有冇成效既時候！
正皮完記得send推牙牙牙牙
呼籲中華民國政府作為《南京條約》、《北京條約》、《展拓香港界址專條》正本持有者、正統中國，勉力收回香港主權

記住唔係要佢支持香港
係話比出面知，台灣一早表明唔會用呢條條例引渡
即係話政府唔可以用呢個名義再去強推
趁宜加103萬人有noise 再做多少少可以會引起國際關注

Ps 1999 如果我柒咗話我知，但我都會做，堅持到最後一秒

香港宜家正值歷史危機當前我想同大家講少少嘢

一百萬人遊行只係個開始，大家仲有好多好多嘢可以做，例如今晚開始直到12號喺政總舉行嘅祈禱聖詩會，甚至罷工罷課等，我希望大家要明白一樣嘢，任何願意作出反惡法嘅行動都應該要支持！香港人唔可以再比三毛分化，和理非同勇武必須要一齊合作，佔大多數嘅和理非請用盡一切合法方法反對逃犯條例，逃犯條例絕對唔可以通過，否則我地同下一代就會生長喺講句說話都要就住就住，擔驚受怕嘅環境之中，大家絕對唔可以比逃犯條例過到

中文template

要求蔡英文總統以總統府名義正式發表聲明回應香港修訂逃犯條例爭議

昨日在香港街頭，香港市民因抗議香港特區政府訛稱因香港居民陳同佳在台灣疑謀殺女友一事，為堵塞香港與台灣之間沒有引渡協議之法律漏洞，而修訂逃犯條例一事，爆發一百零三萬人遊行，人數為史無前例的新高，為中外傳媒報導。

得悉蔡總統昨日已為這事作出口頭回應，表示台灣人支持香港，並補充自由民主之重要。此外，陸委會在五月指出香港特區政府不惜捨易取難，堅持以修訂逃犯條例將陳同佳引到台灣受審，其他可行的選項並不獲港府接受，但陸委會聲明似乎未能引起國際關注。經過昨天遊行，國際傳媒關注香港民意所向，但它們始終較少提及陳同佳疑謀殺女友一案之來龍去脈。然後香港特區政府總統林鄭月娥今日(六月十日)(星期一)表示堅持六月十二日(星期三)在立法會恢復二讀辯論。若蔡總統能在本星期三前以總統府名義發表正式聲明，重申台灣對香港修訂逃犯條例立場，這有助引起國際關注，理解，報導這案件，而且有助向特區政府施壓。

時間緊迫，香港與台灣唇亡齒寒，若特區政府成功修訂逃犯條例，這也會影響台人在港的利益及人身安全。故現誠懇要求蔡總統能於六月十二日(星期三)前以總統府名義就香港修訂逃犯條例一事發表聲明，並向香港特區政府重申台灣立場，凝聚更多關注及為特區政府造成壓力，也保障在台人在港的權益。

耑此函達，祈候示覆。

(下款)
(名稱)

嘗試綜合咗樓主講嘅要點寫咗封信/email
小弟不才，英文唔好，希望各位巴絲可以幫手睇睇有冇文法錯誤或factual error

如果大家覺得啱用嘅請隨便攞去send唔同嘅外國傳媒或者政府機關

人唔喺香港冇辦法同大家一齊作戰，唯有咁樣希望可以為香港出一分綿力


In light of the protest and conflict happened in Hong Kong yesterday (9th June), I, as a citizen of Hong Kong, would like to write to you to convey our most genuine thoughts on the matter.

Since the handover of sovereignty from the UK government to the government of People’s Republic of China, there had been countless instances of PRC’s attempt to intervene the operation of Hong Kong’s legal system.

The amendment of the extradition law recently proposed by the Hong Kong government is one, if not the most unscrupulous one of such action. The Hong Kong government claims that reason of such proposal is to assist the Taiwan government to extradite a suspect of a murder case happened last year, who remains in Hong Kong currently and subsequently to ensure that Hong Kong will not become a “criminal safe haven”. However, the Mainland Affairs Council Republic of China (TAIWAN) has already stated that they are opposed to such amendment and expressed that they refuse to extradite said suspect at the expense of sacrificing the legal autonomy of Hong Kong.

If the bill is passed on in the legislative counsel, the Chinese government will be granted the authority to extradite suspects whom they deem to have violated the law of Mainland China. Such act unequivocally violates the very policy that the legal system of Hong Kong will be different from that of China which is promised in the “one country, two systems” agreement, which is precisely the vital value of Hong Kong as a free and democratic city.

As a result, the government’s response to the voice of the one million protesters who marched for miles in the intolerable heat has proven to be a brutal rejection devoid of humanity and beyond reason. Despite succinctly expressed wish of Hong Kong people as well as the opposition stances of the Taiwan government, the government has chosen to ignore the demand of the people and proceed with reviewing the bill.

I hereby pledge to you all with all sincerity: Please mobilise any influence in journalistic or diplomatic capacity to prevent the Hong Kong government from passing such bill. A city which embraces democracy and freedom as its proudest assets shall not perish under such evil law.

要求蔡英文總統以總統府名義正式發表聲明回應香港修訂逃犯條例爭議

昨日在香港街頭，香港市民因抗議香港特區政府訛稱因香港居民陳同佳在台灣疑謀殺女友一事，為堵塞香港與台灣之間沒有引渡協議之法律漏洞，而修訂逃犯條例一事，爆發一百零三萬人遊行，人數為史無前例的新高，為中外傳媒報導。

得悉蔡總統昨日已為這事作出口頭回應，表示台灣人支持香港，並補充自由民主之重要。此外，陸委會在五月指出香港特區政府不惜捨易取難，堅持以修訂逃犯條例將陳同佳引到台灣受審，其他可行的選項並不獲港府接受，但陸委會聲明似乎未能引起國際關注。經過昨天遊行，國際傳媒關注香港民意所向，但它們始終較少提及陳同佳疑謀殺女友一案之來龍去脈。然後香港特區政府總統林鄭月娥今日(六月十日)(星期一)表示堅持六月十二日(星期三)在立法會恢復二讀辯論。若蔡總統能在本星期三前以總統府名義發表正式聲明，重申台灣對香港修訂逃犯條例立場，這有助引起國際關注，理解，報導這案件，而且有助向特區政府施壓。

時間緊迫，香港與台灣唇亡齒寒，若特區政府成功修訂逃犯條例，這也會影響台人在港的利益及人身安全。故現誠懇要求蔡總統能於六月十二日(星期三)前以總統府名義就香港修訂逃犯條例一事發表聲明，並向香港特區政府重申台灣立場，凝聚更多關注及為特區政府造成壓力，也保障在台人在港的權益。

耑此函達，祈候示覆。

昨日在香港街頭，香港市民因抗議香港特區政府訛稱因香港居民陳同佳在台灣疑謀殺女友一事，為堵塞香港與台灣之間沒有引渡協議之法律漏洞，而修訂逃犯條例一事，引發一百零三萬人遊行，人數為史無前例的新高，為中外傳媒報導。

得悉蔡總統昨日已為這事作出口頭回應，表示台灣人支持香港，並補充自由民主之重要。此外，陸委會在五月指出香港特區政府不惜捨易取難，堅持以修訂逃犯條例將陳同佳引到台灣受審，其他可行的選項並不獲港府接受，但陸委會聲明似乎未能引起國際關注。經過昨天遊行，國際傳媒關注香港民意所向，但它們始終較少提及陳同佳疑謀殺女友一案之來龍去脈。然後香港特區政府總統林鄭月娥六月十日(星期一)表示堅持六月十二日(星期三)在立法會恢復二讀辯論。若蔡總統能在本星期三前以總統府名義發表正式聲明，重申台灣對香港修訂逃犯條例立場，這有助引起國際關注、理解，並報導這案件，向特區政府施壓。

時間緊迫，香港與台灣唇亡齒寒，若特區政府成功修訂逃犯條例，或會影響台人在港的利益及人身安全。故誠懇要求蔡總統能於六月十二日(星期三)前以總統府名義就香港修訂逃犯條例一事發表聲明，並向香港特區政府重申台灣立場，凝聚更多關注及為特區政府造成壓力，也保障在台人在港的權益。

In light of the protest and conflict happened in Hong Kong yesterday (9th June), I, as a citizen of Hong Kong, would like to write to you to convey our most genuine thoughts on the matter.

Since the handover of sovereignty from the UK government to the government of People’s Republic of China, there had been countless instances of PRC’s attempt to intervene the operation of Hong Kong’s legal system.

The amendment of the extradition law recently proposed by the Hong Kong government is one, if not the most unscrupulous one of such action. The Hong Kong government claims that reason of such proposal is to assist the Taiwan government to extradite a suspect of a murder case happened last year, who remains in Hong Kong currently and subsequently to ensure that Hong Kong will not become a “criminal safe haven”. However, the Mainland Affairs Council Republic of China (TAIWAN) has already stated that they are opposed to such amendment and expressed that they refuse to extradite said suspect at the expense of sacrificing the legal autonomy of Hong Kong.

If the bill is passed on in the legislative counsel, the Chinese government will be granted the authority to extradite suspects whom they deem to have violated the law of Mainland China. Such act unequivocally violates the very policy that the legal system of Hong Kong will be different from that of China which is promised in the “one country, two systems” agreement, which is precisely the vital value of Hong Kong as a free and democratic city.

As a result, the government’s response to the voice of the one million protesters who marched for miles in the intolerable heat has proven to be a brutal rejection devoid of humanity and beyond reason. Despite succinctly expressed wish of Hong Kong people as well as the opposition stances of the Taiwan government, the government has chosen to ignore the demand of the people and proceed with reviewing the bill.

I hereby pledge to you all with all sincerity: Please mobilise any influence in journalistic or diplomatic capacity to prevent the Hong Kong government from passing such bill. A city which embraces democracy and freedom as its proudest assets shall not perish under such evil law.
多謝你

改左少少第二段

Ever since the handover of sovereignty from the United Kingdom to the People’s Republic of China, the PRC has never stopped undermining the independence of legal system in the HKSAR.

replies.msg:
完整版本：

In light of the protest and conflict happened in Hong Kong yesterday (9th June), I, as a citizen of Hong Kong, would like to write to you to convey our most genuine thoughts on the matter.

Ever since the handover of sovereignty from the United Kingdom to the People’s Republic of China, the PRC has never stopped undermining the independence of legal system in the HKSAR.

The amendment of the extradition law recently proposed by the Hong Kong government is one, if not the most unscrupulous one of such action. The Hong Kong government claims that reason of such proposal is to assist the Taiwan government to extradite a suspect of a murder case happened last year, who remains in Hong Kong currently and subsequently to ensure that Hong Kong will not become a “criminal safe haven”. However, the Mainland Affairs Council Republic of China (TAIWAN) has already stated that they are opposed to such amendment and expressed that they refuse to extradite said suspect at the expense of sacrificing the legal autonomy of Hong Kong.

If the bill is passed on in the legislative counsel, the Chinese government will be granted the authority to extradite suspects whom they deem to have violated the law of Mainland China. Such act unequivocally violates the very policy that the legal system of Hong Kong will be different from that of China which is promised in the “one country, two systems” agreement, which is precisely the vital value of Hong Kong as a free and democratic city.

As a result, the government’s response to the voice of the one million protesters who marched for miles in the intolerable heat has proven to be a brutal rejection devoid of humanity and beyond reason. Despite succinctly expressed wish of Hong Kong people as well as the opposition stances of the Taiwan government, the government has chosen to ignore the demand of the people and proceed with reviewing the bill.

I hereby pledge to you all with all sincerity: Please mobilise any influence in journalistic or diplomatic capacity to prevent the Hong Kong government from passing such bill. A city which embraces democracy and freedom as its proudest assets shall not perish under such evil law.
岩，蔡英文係美國隻狗， 搵佢幫可能有用

咁樣得唔得呀？（補左上款同下款）

To whom it may concern,

In light of the protest and conflict happened in Hong Kong on 9th June, I, as a citizen of Hong Kong, would like to write to you to convey our most genuine thoughts on the matter.

Ever since the handover of sovereignty from the United Kingdom to the People’s Republic of China, the PRC has never stopped undermining the independence of legal system in the HKSAR.

The amendment of the extradition law recently proposed by the Hong Kong government is one, if not the most unscrupulous one of such action. The Hong Kong government claims that reason of such proposal is to assist the Taiwan government to extradite a suspect of a murder case happened last year, who remains in Hong Kong currently and subsequently to ensure that Hong Kong will not become a “criminal safe haven”. However, the Mainland Affairs Council Republic of China (TAIWAN) has already stated that they are opposed to such amendment and expressed that they refuse to extradite said suspect at the expense of sacrificing the legal autonomy of Hong Kong.

If the bill is passed on in the legislative counsel, the Chinese government will be granted the authority to extradite suspects whom they deem to have violated the law of Mainland China. Such act unequivocally violates the very policy that the legal system of Hong Kong will be different from that of China which is promised in the “one country, two systems” agreement, which is precisely the vital value of Hong Kong as a free and democratic city.

As a result, the government’s response to the voice of the one million protesters who marched for miles in the intolerable heat has proven to be a brutal rejection devoid of humanity and beyond reason. Despite succinctly expressed wish of Hong Kong people as well as the opposition stances of the Taiwan government, the government has chosen to ignore the demand of the people and proceed with reviewing the bill.

I hereby pledge to you all with all sincerity: Please mobilise any influence in journalistic or diplomatic capacity to prevent the Hong Kong government from passing such bill. A city which embraces democracy and freedom as its proudest assets shall not perish under such evil law.

Thank you in advance for your help.

Best Regards,
A Hong-Konger

To whom it may concern,

In light of the protest and conflict happened in Hong Kong on 9th June, I, as a citizen of Hong Kong, would like to write to you to convey our most genuine thoughts on the matter.

Ever since the handover of sovereignty from the United Kingdom to the People’s Republic of China, the PRC has never stopped undermining the independence of legal system in the HKSAR.

The amendment of the extradition law recently proposed by the Hong Kong government is one, if not the most unscrupulous one of such action. The Hong Kong government claims that reason of such proposal is to assist the Taiwan government to extradite a suspect of a murder case happened last year, who remains in Hong Kong currently and subsequently to ensure that Hong Kong will not become a “criminal safe haven”. However, the Mainland Affairs Council Republic of China (TAIWAN) has already stated that they are opposed to such amendment and expressed that they refuse to extradite said suspect at the expense of sacrificing the legal autonomy of Hong Kong.

If the bill is passed on in the legislative counsel, the Chinese government will be granted the authority to extradite suspects whom they deem to have violated the law of Mainland China. Such act unequivocally violates the very policy that the legal system of Hong Kong will be different from that of China which is promised in the “one country, two systems” agreement, which is precisely the vital value of Hong Kong as a free and democratic city.

As a result, the government’s response to the voice of the one million protesters who marched for miles in the intolerable heat has proven to be a brutal rejection devoid of humanity and beyond reason. Despite succinctly expressed wish of Hong Kong people as well as the opposition stances of the Taiwan government, the government has chosen to ignore the demand of the people and proceed with reviewing the bill.

I hereby pledge to you all with all sincerity: Please mobilise any influence in journalistic or diplomatic capacity to prevent the Hong Kong government from passing such bill. A city which embraces democracy and freedom as its proudest assets shall not perish under such evil law.

Thank you in advance for your help.

尊敬的蔡英文總統

香港特區政府正以一宗港人在台殺人案為藉口，修改香港的「逃犯及刑事事宜相互法律協助法例」(下稱「逃犯條例」)。

雖然中華民國政府已表明不接受港府以「一中原則」矮化台灣地位，更不會以此途徑申請引渡疑人；而逾百萬的香港市民更於6月9日上街遊行表明反對港府作為。無奈中共傀儡林鄭月娥卻堅持修例。

作為香港市民，我們希望告知總統閣下，是次修例，嚴重影響香港法治。在尚未修例之前，香港「銅鑼灣書店」店東桂民海出版政治書刊，在泰國失蹤之後，新華社便公告其人因一宗交通意外而向中共「自首投案」。「逃犯條件」一旦通過，未來中共當局可以堆砌任何非政治罪名，指示港府移交在港的「逃犯」，而香港法院只可審視申請是否合乎程序、無從審視有關證據是否實在。

香港台灣交流緊密，是次修例亦嚴重影響在港/訪港台灣人民的安全。中共當局堆砌證據，指定要港府移交的台籍「疑犯」，作為傀儡的港府亦無從拒絕。我們絕不願意看到，日後有類似李明哲先生的台灣人，在來港旅遊時「被送中」。

總統閣下已就港府是次修例表態。我們呼籲，中華民國政府為保護台灣人民人身安全，作出更具體的行動，勸阻港府粗暴修例。包括喻示港府，如強行修例，將限制香港公務人員，尤其在職、前任警務人員進入台灣。

希望中華民國政府的行動，可以令港府迷途知返，收回上述嚴重影響香港法治、影響在港台灣人民人身安全的修例法案。

順祝鈞安

香港市民 XXX
中華民國108年6月X日
